alert.note: Alert for Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 05 at 10:20PM CDT until July 06 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1100 PM CDT FOR ROCK ISLAND...SOUTHWESTERN JACKSON...SCOTT...SOUTHEASTERN JONES...MUSCATINE AND CLINTON COUNTIES... At 1019 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Maquoketa Municipal Airport to Calamus to Wapello, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Davenport, Moline, Rock Island, Bettendorf, Clinton, Muscatine, East Moline, Maquoketa, Durant, Silvis, Eldridge, DeWitt, Milan, Camanche, Le Claire, Coal Valley, Wilton, Hampton, Port Byron and Walcott. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
